name: Public Colleges (Government)
description: Public colleges operated and funded by the government, offering a wide range of undergraduate and postgraduate programs.

name: Private Colleges (Non-Government)
description: Colleges owned and managed by private organizations that offer diverse educational programs, typically funded through tuition fees.

name: Private Medical Colleges
description: Medical colleges run by private entities, providing training in various fields of medicine and healthcare.

name: Public Engineering Colleges
description: Engineering colleges operated by government bodies, offering degrees in various engineering disciplines.

name: Private Engineering Colleges
description: Engineering colleges managed by private organizations, providing specialized engineering education and research opportunities.

name: Polytechnic Institutes
description: Institutes offering diploma-level programs in technical fields such as engineering, applied sciences, and management.

name: Government Agricultural Colleges
description: Agricultural colleges funded and operated by the government, focused on training in farming, agricultural sciences, and related fields.

name: Private Agricultural Colleges
description: Private colleges offering specialized agricultural education and training in various aspects of farming and agribusiness.

name: Public Law Colleges
description: Law colleges funded by the government, providing legal education and training for aspiring lawyers and judges.

name: Private Law Colleges
description: Private institutions offering law degrees and legal education, with a focus on various legal fields and disciplines.

name: Military Colleges
description: Colleges specializing in military education, providing training in defense, military strategy, and leadership.

name: General Public Universities
description: Public universities offering a broad range of academic programs in diverse fields of study, including arts, science, and humanities.

name: Science & Technology Universities
description: Universities focused on the advancement of science and technology, offering programs in engineering, computer science, and more.

name: Engineering & Technology Universities
description: Universities specializing in engineering and technology disciplines, including mechanical, electrical, and civil engineering.

name: Agricultural Universities
description: Universities dedicated to agricultural education and research, including areas such as crop science, animal husbandry, and agribusiness.

name: Medical Universities
description: Medical universities offering comprehensive programs in medical science, training doctors, nurses, and healthcare professionals.

name: Islamic Universities
description: Universities offering education in Islamic studies, theology, and related disciplines, focusing on the teachings of Islam.

name: General Private Universities
description: Private universities offering a wide variety of undergraduate and postgraduate programs across different fields of study.

name: Business & Economics Universities
description: Universities that offer programs in business, economics, management, and entrepreneurship, preparing students for corporate and economic leadership roles.

name: Medical & Health Sciences Universities
description: Universities focused on medical and health sciences education, including nursing, medicine, and public health programs.

name: Islamic & Religious Universities
description: Universities specializing in Islamic and religious studies, offering programs in theology, history, and Islamic philosophy.

name: Public Schools (Government)
description: Public schools funded and operated by the government, offering education to students without tuition fees. They provide a wide range of academic programs and extracurricular activities.

name: Private Schools
description: Privately funded schools that charge tuition fees. They often offer specialized curricula, advanced facilities, and smaller class sizes compared to public schools.

name: International Schools
description: Schools that offer an international curriculum, often following global standards like the International Baccalaureate (IB) or British A-Levels, catering to expatriates and globally minded students.
